key_points: President Biden announces new actions to protect Americans against the Delta and Omicron variants of COVID-19 during the winter months.
The plan aims to increase booster vaccinations, keep schools and businesses open, and prepare for potential surges.
It includes making booster shots available for all adults, expanding free at-home testing, and enhancing protocols for international travel.
Workplace protections and rapid response teams are part of the strategy to minimize economic disruptions and health risks.
Treatment pills to prevent hospitalizations and death, as well as continued global vaccination efforts, are emphasized.
Immediate travel restrictions were imposed following the WHO's declaration of Omicron as a Variant of Concern.
Nearly 60% of Americans are fully vaccinated, with booster shots authorized for all adults and vaccines available for children aged 5 and older.
The FDA is reviewing additional antiviral treatments as part of the broader response to COVID-19.
Increased pharmacy participation and a public education campaign, especially targeted at seniors, are key components of the booster strategy.
AARP collaborates with the administration on an education campaign to encourage booster shots among seniors.
